sect2.title: Introduction
sect2.para: Zend_ProgressBar is a component to create and update progressbars in different enviroments. It consists of a single backend, which outputs the progress through one of the multiple adapters. On every update, it takes an absolute value and optionally a status message, and then calls the adapter with some precalculated values like percentage and estimated time left.

sect2.title: Basic usage of Zend_Progressbar

In the first step, an instance of Zend_ProgressBar is created, with a min-value of 0, a max-value of the total filesize and a specific adapter. Then a file is processed and in every loop the progressbar is updated with the current byte count. At the end of the loop, the progressbar status is set to finished.
Zend_ProgressBar also has a refresh() method which just recalculates ETA and updates the adapter. This is useful when there is no data update but you want the progressbar to be updated.
